title: Feature Request: `resize_()` with -1 dimension
body_html:
It seems the Tensor can be resized with -1 dimension, which is very convenient to be batch size.

This can be done in Numpy:

a = np.zeros([5*4*3])
a.reshape([-1, 3])

with the shape [20, 3]

However, in PyTorch

a = torch.zeros([5*4*3])
a.resize_([-1, 3])

with the shape None, i.e. the data is even missing.

Hope this feature could be added.

body:
It seems the Tensor can be resized with -1 dimension, which is very convenient to be batch size. 

This can be done in Numpy:
```
a = np.zeros([5*4*3])
a.reshape([-1, 3])
```
with the shape `[20, 3]`

However, in PyTorch
```
a = torch.zeros([5*4*3])
a.resize_([-1, 3])
```
with the shape `None`, i.e. the data is even missing. 

Hope this feature could be added.
